question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration.
Please help me implement the following requirement using code, specifically creating it using SVG code. The requirement is to create: Using a kitchen grater to shred cheese.

checklist.title: Is the kitchen grater accurately represented in SVG?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG code properly renders a recognizable kitchen grater with appropriate structure (handle, body with holes/grating surface). Evaluate if the proportions are realistic and the grater has sufficient detail to be identifiable. Score 0 if the grater is unrecognizable, 5 if basic but lacking detail, 10 if properly detailed with accurate proportions.

checklist.title: Is the cheese representation and shredding effect convincing?
checklist.description: Assess whether the cheese is visually distinct and realistically portrayed. Check if the shredded cheese particles look authentic and if the transformation from block to shreds is properly visualized. Deduct 5 points if cheese texture is unrealistic, 3 points if shreds lack dimension or variation, and 2 points if the cheese block appears too synthetic. Full score for realistic cheese with proper texture and convincing shreds.

checklist.title: Is the animation of cheese shredding implemented correctly?
checklist.description: Evaluate the animation showing the cheese being shredded against the grater. Animation should include the movement of cheese against the grater, creation of shreds, and proper timing. Score 0 if no animation exists, 5 if basic motion is shown but lacks realism, 10 if animation includes smooth movement, proper physics representation, and convincing transformation of cheese into shreds.

checklist.title: Is user interaction incorporated to enhance the demonstration?
checklist.description: Check if interactive elements allow users to control the grating process (e.g., dragging the cheese, controlling speed, changing angle). Award 3 points for basic click interaction, 7 points for drag-and-grate functionality, and full 10 points if multiple interactive elements work together (adjusting speed, angle, pressure) with proper visual feedback.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, window resizing, interrupted animations) and provide fallbacks or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Different cheese types with unique textures 2. Variable grating speeds affecting shred size 3. Physics-based particle effects for the cheese shreds). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements that increase file size without visual benefit 2. Unnecessary animations that don't contribute to the kitchen grater demonstration 3. Complex effects that slow down rendering performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functionality is compromised by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (separation of SVG structure, styles, and animations), code reusability (use of symbols, groups, or components), and optimization for performance. Deduct 5 points for excessive inline styles rather than grouped CSS; deduct 5 points for repetitive path definitions that could be reused; deduct 5 points for animations that cause performance issues. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (realistic colors for kitchen implements) 2) Proper proportions and perspective 3) Appropriate level of detail without overwhelming the visual space. Deduct 3 points for unrealistic colors, 5 points for perspective inconsistencies, and 5 points for either excessive or insufficient detail. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to real-world physics: 1) Smooth grating motion without jerky transitions 2) Realistic accumulation of cheese shreds 3) Proper timing for the entire process that matches real-life expectations. Deduct 5 points for unrealistic motion physics, 3 points for inconsistent animation timing, and 5 points for visual glitches during the animation. The full score is 10 points.
